project.title: SPIDER-MAN Official Commercial Trailer : Spiderman
project.description:
SPIDER-MAN Commercial trailer (2018)

I was given the opportunity to work on ye olde web slinger for Insomniac's Spider-man (2018). 
Started out with the original model from Insomniac Games, and did some art things!

Special shoutout to the team at Blur for all their hard work on this show!

project.title: River stones Material
project.description:
I wanted to have some fun testing Ben Wilson's new flood fill to corners node while doing another Master Study of Dannie Carlone's Smooth Stone material using megascans and Designer to achieve the same effect. Really fun experiment and I am pretty happy with the results I was able to get in a short space of time. 

https://www.artstation.com/marketplace/p/P5V7/bw-flood-fill-to-corners-substance-designer-node?utm_source=artstation&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=homepage&utm_term=marketplace

project.title: Star Wars Battlefront Death Star
project.description: I worked as a Senior Environment Artist on the Death Star dlc for Star Wars Battlefront released 2016. Getting to create the Death Star surface and trench run map was a real thrill and a childhood dream come true. Figuring out the best way to create the Death Star surface models was really fun due to it¬¥s mathematical and uniform shapes, I settled on 7 pieces in the end. I worked closely with Mikael Andersson on the first chapter where you play in and around asteroids, space debris and the massive Star Destroyers. Dennis Br√§nnval was the creative mind behind the layout of the trench run and he is always very inspirational and fun to work with.

project.title: Star Wars Battlefront Sullust
project.description: I worked as a Senior Environment Artist on the planet Sullust for the first Star Wars Battlefront released in 2015. It was a small tight team with a high output! These are screenshots from the main game as well as the Outer Rim dlc and the Death Star dlc.

project.title: Arishalla - The Plains
project.description: The vast plains of Arishalla, outside of the heavily populated cities. These abstracted landscapes dominate the grassy regions of the world. Sculptural forms are embedded within the Papier-m√¢ch√© walls, multi colored paint defining the patterns of the cultures in the area. Some interior props are also found around these areas, wind chimes hand crafted by villagers, or blown glass figures.

project.title: Industrial Harbour asset pack
project.description:
This industrial Harbour asset pack is a product our team at elite3d created for the Unity asset store.
We worked on a wide variety of modular, detailed assets ranging from large structural elements as well as cargo ships, shipyard cranes and warehouses.
I was responsible alongside Beatriz Morales Marco Antonio Meireles, Elisa Consolini and Rick Vervuurt, under the supervision of Alejandro Monz√∫, for the set dressing, optimization and modeling of some assets.
https://www.artstation.com/beatrizmorales
https://www.artstation.com/marcoantoniomeirelescarvalho
https://www.artstation.com/rickvervuurt
https://www.artstation.com/monzombo
https://www.artstation.com/elyco

project.title: FORTNITE | THE FLASH
project.description:
The Fastest Human Alive has arrived to the Island!

I was a big fan of the original live action tv series played by John Wesley Shipp when I was a kid so getting the opportunity to texture and lookdev this CW version was awesome.

Much like Daredevil, the challenge was to get a completely red character look interesting without everything feeling the same. So a lot of care was placed on defining unique a readable materials that unique but worked together.

Hope you guys enjoy!

Model by Fedor Moshura
Textures and Materials by myself
Concepts by Epic Games

project.title: Middle Eastern Courtyard (UE4)
project.description:
Now available for download at:
https://www.unrealengine.com/marketplace/en-US/product/middle-eastern-courtyard 


I decided to revisit one of my previous environments, update it to the latest version of Unreal Engine and put it up on the marketplace.
Even though the layout and props are pretty much as the same as the first version I made sure to go trough the environment and prepare it for a downloadable game ready package. I made sure to get the environment to work with ray tracing and I also made a cinematic sequence with a new video to show the environment a bit better. Hope you enjoy it.

project.description: I tried to study on how to render cloth and other material these days. This is my character in my IP also.

project.title: Wilderness
project.description:
My 5th attempt to mix my painting style with the styles from classic painters from the 40-60s. And again this felt very natural for me, I guess the reason is that I always made drawings with stippling and a sense of geometric shapes to build stuff. A few more attempts and I think I might find a style that I'll finally repeat. I usually do not repeat styles, so I can keep learning, but this mix is so fun to do. :)

Sketch with 2B pencil on rough hand-cut paper then everything else on Photoshop.

project.title: Knox  (werewolf form)
project.description:
Here's some work for a werewolf film Idea I've had for ages. 
I really want to make these creatures scary again, this is a brutal killer who takes pleasure in hunting and killing innocent people so I  really want to reflect that in the design and move away from the classic muscular look.

project.title: Sankari Village
project.description:
Here is a village I created for a game assignment in school last year, and after my thesis I had some time to polish it up! I used a modular workflow for the houses, and created Substance Designer materials and shaders for a faster workflow. The village in whole took me less than a month to create in Unreal Engine 4.

A big thank you to Jeryce for mentoring me throughout the project!

project.title: Stroem
project.description:
Str√∏m‚Äîa homage to Raawii and Vilhelm Lundstr√∏m.

As fans of Vilhelm Lundstr√∏m‚Äôs work, we immediately fell in love with the Raawii Str√∏m Collection by Danish designer Nicholas Wiig Hansen. 

The clean geometric shapes and bright colors inspired us to create a homage where each object of the collection is treated as a character with it‚Äôs own characteristics. 

The result is a colorful and surreal world where ceramics come to life‚Äîone by one.

Concept and 3D by PomPom
Collection design by Nicholas Wiig Hansen
Sound design by Povel Olsson

project.title: Amazon-Halo
project.description: This project is an interesting case study in adaptability. Amazon initially came to us to help make auxiliary videos to help support a live action product launch for their new Halo device. But then the pandemic hit and live action was suddenly off the table ‚Äî Amazon was left in the lurch. If only they knew a full-service animation studio who could still deliver the goods...

project.title: Brabham-shading
project.description: This project is a small part of a big personal cgi challenge i'm doing currently and it is my first car render. I did all the shading of the car procedurally inside 3DS Max and i used V-Ray. It took more than i expected to finish it, considering it is a side personal project. I will probably work on it more in the future but now it works for its purpose and it is time to keep going with the main scene i'm making.\nThe car is a free model made by Szymon Kubicki: https:\/\/www.behance.net\/kubicki3d
